Since communications reliability is of paramount importance, adequate link margins were allowed for unpredictable losses due to weather, misalignments and equipment degradation. Estimates of 2 dB for excess path attenuation and lO0 K for excess noise were used for earth stations in the U. K. and Singapore which are served by a suitably placed geostationary satellite. Losses were greater for an earth station with a radome because of the attenuation of a water film on the surface. Re' ductions in signal/noise ratios of up to 6 dB have been observed witha radome under wet conditions. Margins for both "up" and "down" links had to be allowed if a local rain squall were not to upset the power balance of the entire system.. 15.2.1 Control Subsystem.
